titleStmt.title: Philanthropophagia, delineated in A mirthless mirrour of the matchless misery of a money-less minister, born in the south [of England.] Mischievously managed by the merciless misdemeanour of a money-minded minster-man, living in the north of England. Or, a true narrative of the inexcusable inhumanity of one Mr. Timothie Tullie, late preacher at Carlisle, now one of the prebendaries of the cathedrall church of York. Acted against one Thomas Kentish, rector of Middleton in Teasdale within the county of Durham. Written by the aforesaid Thomas Kentish minister of the gospel
titleStmt.author: Kentish, Thomas, d. 1695.

titleStmt.title: Philanthropophagia, delineated in A mirthless mirrour of the matchless misery of a money-less minister, born in the south [of England.] Mischievously managed by the merciless misdemeanour of a money-minded minster-man, living in the north of England. Or, a true narrative of the inexcusable inhumanity of one Mr. Timothie Tullie, late preacher at Carlisle, now one of the prebendaries of the cathedrall church of York. Acted against one Thomas Kentish, rector of Middleton in Teasdale within the county of Durham. Written by the aforesaid Thomas Kentish minister of the gospel
titleStmt.author: Kentish, Thomas, d. 1695.

publicationStmt.date: printed in the moneth of December, 1661.

notesStmt.note: First line of title page in Greek characters.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
